title: Homer - The Iliad & Odyssey (15 translations)
description:
HOMER (ca. 7th or 8th century BCE) is revered as the greatest of ancient Greek epic poets.  His ILIAD and ODYSSEY are the two oldest extant works of Western literature and have exerted an enormous influence on the history of literature.

The ILIAD is set during the Trojan War, the ten-year siege of the city of Troy (Ilium) by a coalition of Greek states, and tells of the battles and events during the weeks of a quarrel between King Agamemnon and the warrior Achilles.

The ODYSSEY is, in part, a sequel to the Iliad, and mainly centers on the Greek hero Odysseus (known as Ulysses in Roman myths) and his journey home after the fall of Troy.


Included here are 6 translations of the ILIAD and 9 translations of the ODYSSEY in a mix of EPUB and/or PDF formats as indicated below:

* THE ILIAD (Penguin Classics, 1990).  Translated by Robert Fagles, with an Introduction and Notes by Bernard Knox. -- EPUB + PDF

* THE ILIAD (Doubleday, 1974).  Translated by Robert Fitzgerald. -- PDF

* THE ILIAD (University of Chicago Press, 2011).  Translated by Richard Lattimore, with an Introduction and Notes by Richard Martin. -- EPUB

* THE ILIAD (1963; Barnes & Noble Classics, 2005).  Translated by Ennis Rees, with an Introduction and Notes by Bruce M. King. -- EPUB

* THE ILIAD (Penguin Classics, 2003).  Translated by E. V. Rieu, revised by Peter Jones with D. C. H. Rieu; edited with an Introduction and Notes by Peter Jones. -- EPUB


* THE ODYSSEY (Penguin Classics, 1996).  Translated by Robert Fagles, with an Introduction and Notes by Bernard Knox. -- EPUB + PDF

* THE ODYSSEY (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1998).  Translated by Robert Fitzgerald, with an Introduction by D. S. Carne-Ross. -- EPUB + PDF

* THE ODYSSEY (Richer Resources, 2007).  Translated by Ian Johnston. -- PDF

* THE ODYSSEY (HarperCollins, 2007).  Translated with an Introduction by Richard Lattimore. -- EPUB

* THE ESSENTIAL ODYSSEY [Selections] (Hackett, 2007).  Translated and edited by Stanley Lombardo, with an Introduction by Sheila Murnaghan. -- PDF

* THE ODYSSEY (University of Michigan Press, 2002).  Translated by Rodney Merrill, with Introductions by Thomas R. Walsh and Rodney Merrill. -- PDF

* THE ODYSSEY (1921; Barnes & Noble Classics, 2003).  Translated by George Herbert Palmer, edited with an Introduction and Notes by Robert Squillace. -- EPUB

* THE ODYSSEY (Penguin Classics, 2003).  Translated by E. V. Rieu, revised by D. C. H. Rieu, and with an Introduction by Peter Jones. -- EPUB


* THE ILIAD & ODYSSEY (Wordsworth Classics, 2002).  Translated by George Chapman, with an Introduction by Jan Parker. -- EPUB
